tooltip.orimod.durability.repairlimit.3: you must use an Anvil with the
info.orimod.lumowand.dbg_charge: DEBUG: Applied/Removed charge to this block.
entity.orimod.spirit.name: Spirit
block.orimod.light_conduit.tip: Links devices together to route power.
block.orimod.solid_light_conduit.tip: Links devices together to route power.
block.orimod.light_to_redstone_signal.ti: Produces a redstone signal when powered.
block.orimod.infinite_light_source.tip: Provides unlimited power at an unlimited rate.
block.orimod.thermal_generator.tip: Converts heat into Luxen. Optimal in The Nether.
block.orimod.light_repair_box.tip: Consumes Luxen to repair hardlight items.
death.attack.self_energy: %s sacrificed too much of their internal Light.
death.attack.self_energy.player: %2$s tricked %1$s into spending too much of their internal Light.
orimod.spirit_restrictions.no_meat: You know you can't eat this. You're a herbivore!
config.orimod.spirit_abilities.def_jump_: What type of jumping Spirits can do as soon as they become one.
config.orimod.spirit_abilities.def_dash_: What type of dashing Spirits can do as soon as they become one.
config.orimod.spirit_abilities.def_wall_: Whether or not Spirit players will know to wall jump and wall cling as soon as they become one.
config.orimod.spirit_management.default_: The Default State mandates whether or not new saves (or new players, on servers) will start out as a Spirit by default.
config.orimod.spirit_management.force_st: If enabled, all players, including those that have the permission to change whether or not they are a Spirit, will be forced to either be a Player or a Spirit based on the Default State.
config.orimod.spirit_management.allow_ch: Whether or not to allow players to change between Player and Spirit. There is a permissions file that dictates who is explicitly allowed to, and who is explicitly not allowed to, which can be used to override this value per player.
config.orimod.spirit_management.change_m: Required op level to set self
What operator permission level must a player have to use /spirit set on themselves?
config.orimod.spirit_management.change_a: Required op level to change self abilities
What operator permission level must a player have to use /spirit ability on themselves?
config.orimod.spirit_management.change_m: Required op level to set others
What operator permission level must a player have to use /spirit set on other players?
config.orimod.spirit_management.change_a: Required op level to change others abilities
What operator permission level must a player have to use /spirit ability on other players?
config.orimod.spirit_management.use_old_: Before v2.0.0, the 5 heart limit was imposed by dividing the total max health by 2. This interfered with changes to max health adversely, and so it was changed to subtraction instead. If this change has broken your server or save, turn this setting on to go back to the old divide method.
config.orimod.spirit_limits.only_eat_pla: Foodstuffs that classify as meat will be inedible by Spirits if this is enabled.
config.orimod.spirit_limits.self_repair_: Some tools and devices allow Spirits to use their own life energy as a means of repair. This determines the extent in which that is possible.
config.orimod.spirit_limits.anyone_can_s: Allow Normal Players To Self-Repair Light Tools
Under normal circumstances, non-spirit players cannot use their life to repair hardlight tools. If this is true, this limitation is bypassed.
config.orimod.spirit_limits.self_repair_: How much health does a single self-powered repair take? Note that 2 health is 1 heart.
How much durability gets restored when repairing with your own energy?
config.orimod.light_energy.env_power.des: §cThis is not yet functional.§f If enabled, environments of §5Decay §for §bLight §fwill reduce or improve the efficiency of Light-based devices, making it harder to run machines in §5Decay §fenvironments and easier in §bLight §fenvironments.
config.orimod.light_energy.show_rf.descr: §dRequires mod: Jade §r-- This determines when to display the RF equivalent of any given amount of Luxen.
config.orimod.rendering.assembly_debug.d: The §bA§fssembly §bO§fptimization §bS§fystem is responsible for allowing excessively large machines to have low CPU usage. This option will cause debugging info for the AOS to show when the debug menu (F3) is open. §cThis feature can make the debug menu very laggy!§f
config.orimod.rendering.override_health_: If enabled, the vanilla heart renderer (on your HUD) is disabled and replaced with a near-identical implementation from this mod. This enables support for custom heart types when inflicted with effects like Decay, but may also cause compatibility issues with mods that change how health renders.
config.orimod.world.spirit_materials.des: Binds blocks or block states to a specific SpiritMaterial, which changes the sound when stepping on a block of that material.
config.orimod.world.decay.spreading.desc: Dictates how all §5Decay §fspreads in the world. It can either spread (spreads on random ticks, replaces blocks it can infect), not spread, or flat out not exist (it will cure or remove itself on random ticks)
config.orimod.world.decay.surface_coatin: Dictates how all §5Decay Surface Mycelium §fspreads in the world. This setting functions identically to the normal spread setting otherwise. §cThis is limited by the general spread settings§f.
config.orimod.world.decay.fluid.descript: Dictates how all §5Decay Poison §fspreads in the world. This block is particularly aggressive in that it infects and replaces water. This setting functions identically to the normal spread setting otherwise. §cThis is limited by the general spread settings§f.
config.orimod.world.decay.diagonal_sprea: If enabled, §5Decay §fblocks can spread diagonally by one block. This has somewhat of a performance impact (albeit minor). If disabled, they will only spread to the six direct neighbors to any given block, but can leverage a performance boost.
config.orimod.assembly_optimization_syst: This can be used to keep chunks containing functional Light tech (§7meaning they must be doing something with their energy§f) alive. This §aimproves gameplay by allowing tech to operate whilst unattended §fat the cost of §cmore CPU usage (the usage scales with how much is going on)§f.

Big sets of wires and devices are complicated. This setting decides how many + or T shaped wire joints the system can go through when searching for connected technology blocks. If there's too many branches, the system determines the assembly to be too complicated and gives up partway through. Higher values allow more largely interconnected machines, but also introduce a significant amount of server lag when changing the wiring (thankfully, there is not lag from the system existing, only from it changing).
config.jade.plugin_orimod.show_forlorn_s: Show whether a Forlorn-style block is Blue or Orange
config.jade.plugin_orimod.show_energy: Show stored Luxen in tech blocks

command.orimod.setspirit.success.self: Success! Your state of being a Spirit has changed to: %1$s
command.orimod.getspirit.status: Player %1$s has a spirit state of: %2$s

§cYou do not have permission to change if other players are Spirits.
command.orimod.setspirit.failure.server_: §cThis server or save is enforcing that players always use the current state. You cannot change it.
command.orimod.setspirit.failure.set_abi: §cYou do not have permission to set the abilities of other Spirits.
§cYou do not have permission to set your own abilities.
command.orimod.setspirit.success.ability: Success! Data belonging to %1$s has been set to
command.orimod.getstatedata.enforce: Enforcing this state on all players constantly
command.orimod.setstatedata: Settings updated. New players will be spirits? %s. Is this state enforced on all players? %s.
command.setspirit.error.nocaps: Your player data is missing crucial data. Please report this bug (you can find the report link in the Mods menu on the title screen). Try rejoining or changing dimensions.
